summary: Provides the infrastructure for handling Cython compiler configuration, including a class that stores and normalises compilation options, applies language‑specific defaults, validates values, and produces a unique fingerprint for a given option set. It also defines utilities for copying option objects, accessing directive defaults, normalising encodings, and parsing directive values, though many of these helpers are currently unused.
business_intent: Enable flexible and reproducible configuration of the Cython compilation process by managing compiler options and directives, supporting language‑specific defaults, and ensuring consistent builds through option fingerprinting.
